pages.title: Safe people
pages.description:
In order to ensure 'Safe People' and to give confidence that users can be trusted to use the data in an appropriate manner, researchers need to be accredited by ICODA before they can access the Workbench. 
Please complete this form in order to help us achieve this. This should include education, professional qualifications and memberships that are relevant to the research project, including any up to date Information Governance training (e.g. in the UK evidence of completing the [ONS Safe User of Research data Environments] (https://www.ons.gov.uk/aboutus/whatwedo/statistics/requestingstatistics/approvedresearcherscheme) course, or the [MRC's Regulatory Support Centre Confidentiality e-learning](https://byglearning.com/mrcrsc-lms/course/index.php?categoryid=1) or internationally  [The Global Health Network's Data Sharing course](https://globalhealthtrainingcentre.tghn.org/data-sharing/)). Within a team, we would expect to see at least one qualified statistician, or someone with equivalent experience.

pages.title: Safe project
pages.description:
In order to ensure 'Safe Projects', proposals will be reviewed to ensure there is a valid research purpose with a defined public benefit.  
For access to data to be granted the researchers need to demonstrate that their proposal is an appropriate and ethical use of the data, and that it is intended to deliver clear public benefit.  The purpose of this section is to understand

- the project rationale, which should be explained in lay terms for the public and patients
- that the research purpose has a defined public benefit. This can be new knowledge, new treatments, improved pathways of care, new techniques of training staff. 
- how the data requested will be used to achieve the project objectives.

Safe data ensures that researchers have a clear legal basis for accessing the data and do not inadvertently learn something about the data subjects during the course of their analysis, minimising the risks of re-identification. You have already selected the datasets you wish to access and that will be reviewed to ensure:

- there is a clear legal basis for accessing the requested data
- the data requested is proportionate to the requirement of the project
- all data requested is necessary in order to achieve the public benefit declared
- data subjects cannot be identified by your team by cross-referencing data sets from anywhere else
- justification for requirement of any sensitive data items
- measures that would be taken if findings are potentially sensitive.
pages.title: Safe data
Safe outputs
pages.description:
Safe outputs ensure that research outputs cannot be used to identity data subjects. 
The purpose of this section is to ensure that

- controls are in place to minimise risks associated with planned outputs and publications 

- researchers aim to openly publish their results to enable use, scrutiny and further research.

questions.question: This application is...
questions.guidance: The application could be a new application, an extension, a renewal or amendment. For extensions or amendments, you must highlight the specific information within this form that has been updated, provide an original application number and approval date, any subsequent amendment approval dates and a summary of changes and rationale for the change to your original application and an updated approvals signature in order for the request to be processed.

options.text: An amendment to an existing application
options.value: An amendment to an existing application

conditionalQuestions.question: Reference or details of previous application
Reference or details of previous application

options.text: An extension of an existing approval
options.value: An extension of an existing approval

options.value: A renewal of an existing approval
options.text: A renewal of an existing approval

options.value: Related to a previous application (approved or not)
options.text: Related to a previous application (approved or not)

questions.guidance: Please note the accreditation process will be started on the completion of this form, if you currently do not have accreditation.

conditionalQuestions.question: Reference or details of previous accreditation
conditionalQuestions.guidance: Please add details of your existing ICODA accreditation.

options.guidance: Please note the accreditation process will be started on the completion of this form, if you currently do not have accreditation.

input.label: Have you received an accreditation from ICODA

questions.question: Have you received an accreditation from ICODA
Job title
questions.guidance: Job Title is the name of the position the applicant holds within their organisation.
Please include a contact telephone number, including international dialling code, the applicant can be contacted on.
questions.question: Telephone
ORCID
questions.guidance: ORCID provides a persistent digital identifier (an ORCID iD) that you own and control, and that distinguishes you from every other researcher. You can create an ORCID profile at q.
Please include an email address that the applicant can receive communications through.
questions.question: Email

questions.guidance: The role is the function the applicant plays in the project team, including members accessing the secure data or who would see cleared outputs from the project (i.e. principal investigator, researcher, collaborator etc.).
questions.question: Role on research team

input.label: Will you access the data requested?

questions.guidance: Please confirm whether the applicant will be accessing and working with the data that is being requested, or if you are applying on someone else's behalf.
questions.question: Will you access the data requested?
Please provide evidence of the team's expertise and experience relevant to delivering the project (3000 characters)
Organisation name
questions.guidance: Please provide legal name to appear on legal documents.
Please confirm sponsor organisation postcode or zipcode.
questions.question: Postcode
Is this application regarding a project?

input.label: Is this application regarding a project?

conditionalQuestions.question: Title of project
conditionalQuestions.guidance: The title should identify the main area of your research so that other researchers can understand any relevance to their area of study.

conditionalQuestions.question: What is the prospective start date of the project?
What is the anticipated end date of the project?
Please provide a lay summary of the project (5000 characters)
conditionalQuestions.guidance: Your lay summary must be written in plain English and should provide a high-level overview of your research project, including a description of the anticipated public health benefit. It should enable a general public audience to understand the research question and aims of the project. If your project is approved, the summary will be published on the ICODA website.

Include the project background describing why you are proposing the study, the specific aims and the hypotheses that you plan to test. Summarise how the data requested are required to address these aims. Please include whether the proposal has been through any form of peer review.
conditionalQuestions.question: What are the project aims, objectives and rationale? (2000 characters)

conditionalQuestions.guidance:
Please describe your study hypotheses and primary outcome measure/s and how you will use them to addresses the research objectives? Provide a description of your statistical analysis plan, including:
- Primary objective and, if applicable, secondary objective(s)
- Primary outcome measure and, if applicable, secondary measure(s)
- Data variables required
- Statistical methodology (e.g. for meta-analysis state model choice, fixed or random effects, assessment of bias, heterogeneity, meta-regression etc.)
- Planned subgroup analysis (e.g. age, race, disease status, co-morbidities etc.)
conditionalQuestions.question: What is your proposed methodology and statistical analysis approach? (2000 characters)

input.label: Do you intend the datasets requested to be linked with any additional datasets, other than the datasets listed in this application?

questions.question: Do you intend the datasets requested to be linked with any additional datasets, other than the datasets listed in this application?
Please indicate the data necessary to conduct the study, the data fields required and the justifications for including each field. (3000 characters)
Time period for which data is requested
Geographical area for which data is requested
Please list any sensitive data items required with justification for their requirement. (500 characters)
How will your findings be made public, to which audiences and in which formats, including how you intend to generate impact? (1000 characters)
Please describe your publication plans, including how you would publicise potentially sensitive findings . (1000 characters)
Please describe what disclosure control policy and procedures will be applied to ensure individual level data is not identifiable. (1000 characters)
